articles.title: Hamburg
articles.image_title: (FILES) This file photo taken on June 28, 2022 shows defendant Irmgard F, a former secretary for the SS commander of the Stutthof concentration camp, prior to the continuation of her trial in a courtroom in Itzehoe, northern Germany. - The 97-year-old former Nazi camp secretary has filed an appeal against her conviction of complicity in the murder of more than 10,000 people, a German court said on December 28, 2022. She was the first woman in decades to be tried in Germany for Nazi-era crimes. She had been handed a two-year suspended sentence for her role in what prosecutors called the "cruel and malicious murder" of prisoners at the Stutthof camp in occupied Poland. (Photo by Marcus Brandt / POOL / AFP)

articles.title: Hamburg
articles.image_title: Daniel Günther (CDU, l-r), Ministerpräsident von Schleswig-Holstein, Franziska Giffey (SPD, Regierende Bürgermeisterin von Berlin, und Peter Tschentscher (SPD), Erster Bürgermeister von Hamburg und Bundesratspräsident, nehmen an der Sitzung des Bundesrats teil.
